title: UV Radiation
image_desc: A diagram showing the different types of UV radiation with their wavelengths and penetration depths.
content: - UV radiation is a type of electromagnetic radiation emitted by the sun.
It is divided into three categories: UVA, UVB, and UVC.
UVA rays are the longest and penetrate the skin the deepest.
UVB rays are shorter and cause sunburn.
UVC rays are the shortest and are absorbed by the ozone layer.
narration: UV radiation is a type of energy that comes from the sun. It's divided into three types: UVA, UVB, and UVC. UVA rays are the longest and reach deep into the skin. UVB rays are shorter and cause sunburn. UVC rays are the shortest and are absorbed by the ozone layer, which protects us from their harmful effects.
